actionUnits.condition: MonoBehaviour id 314576056 (script GUID 27b31662383b39d4a9c98eb14ed39152) on GameObject 'ClockText' matches the provided Clock script settings (time=0, clockText=fileID 314576054, BestTime=fileID 1936206876, finished=false). MonoBehaviour id 1331476503 has m_Script guid a8a2c5194e4c1f1458096e7bee47220e, which exactly matches the provided DoorAnimationEvent script. MonoBehaviour(id: 1060933185, script guid: 695ad83b06c34684fac24f392ff03680) is KeyPadControll attached to Keypad. It exposes public bool CheckIfCorrect(int combination) and a UnityEvent onCorrectCode configured in scene meta with m_PersistentCalls -> GameObject(fileID: 822093423).SetActive(true). First, simulate an incorrect code entry (e.g., call CheckIfCorrect with a value != 4826) through the keypad UI/buttons so that accessGranted remains false and onCorrectCode is NOT invoked.

Now simulate entering the correct combination 4826 by invoking KeyPadControll.CheckIfCorrect(4826) via the keypad input flow (buttons/child scripts). This sets accessGranted = true, and on the next Update() the script calls onCorrectCode.Invoke(), which triggers the configured persistent call: GameObject(fileID: 822093423).SetActive(true). After invocation, Update() resets accessGranted = false.

MonoBehaviour(id: 899989824, script guid: ffd4469d3349eb647afb29c196c0a1d4) is KeyFeedback attached to Button(1). Scene meta shows BoxCollider(id: 899989820, isTrigger=1) and Rigidbody present, but no UnityEvent m_Calls are configured on this object. To cover KeyFeedback.Update branch that plays audio and flashes color, simulate a key press by setting KeyFeedback.keyHit = true at the start of this trigger window. Expected: Start() has already added AudioSource and captured Renderer/material color; Update() detects keyHit, calls audioSource.PlayOneShot(keySound), sets returnColor = Time.time + 0.1, renderer.material.color = Color.green, and resets keyHit = false.

Wait beyond colorReturnTime (0.1s) so that KeyFeedback.Update covers the second branch which restores the material color: if renderer.material.color != originalColor and returnColor < Time.time, set renderer.material.color back to originalColor. No scene m_Calls exist to auto-invoke this; it occurs in Update after the first trigger.
